page.title: 03DULAIS VALLEY
page.content: The Dulais valley is situated at the southern edge of the Brecon Beacons National park.Some 6miles away at Blaen-nant colliery is the Cefn-coed coal and steam museum which is open to the public all the year round.About 9 miles away the Aberdulais Falls and canal complex and the Penscynor wild life park are also to be found.Along the summit of Hirfynydd runs the remains of the roman road from Neath to Brecon called Sarn Helen.Industrial remains and coal refuse tips used to be very much in evidence but land reclamation and landscaping have got rid of many of these former eyesores. The Forestry Commission have also established picnic and viewing areas and walks for people to be able to explore and enjoy the area natural beauty.This may prove to be a great help to the area in the future.
